text: We been coming here for lunch mostly TO GO.food is good we like it however,we noticed that some of the Guys that work there has mental issues.today me and my 9 year old son was there,when I was parking my suv,there was a red pickup truck door wide open,I just noticed when I was about to park this guy inside was very angry that I have to park right beside his truck and he insisted on closing his door.when I finally park my suv,he was cursing at me really angry and opened his door again..I was worried that my son was seating right beside his truck,we got down and i could tell that he was yelling at me but this time his door was closed now.then he was opening his door like he's trying to scare me.anyway,having my son with me I just went straight to the restaurant.I complained to the people inside working.and they said yeah "HE WORKS HERE and Hes a little crazy" and he told me to go ahead and beat him up?? so I was like what?? the guy inside said "we feel the same way".I just said I am getting harrased w my son and if I call the cops were gonna have a big problem.no response exept that he want me to beat him up!?this is not the first time theres also a younger asian guy that has a very bad attitude working in there and he seems like hes always angry about somethings.This is a really bad experience that I have decided to not to come back there.weird people working in there pushing me to fight with my son with the crazy guy.
This place is the best. Their Tia tea is good and so is there food only problem is that they don't have " fresh Spring rolls".
really good food and friendly staff. not to mention cheap prices. no complaints at all.
I'll be returning. Good noodle dishes, both of us had a great time here. Good service. Good taste. Along with modest prices.

Decided to try something different as I haven't been thrilled with their curry (red or panang) lately. Used to like the pumpkin curry, but last time I ordered it I was only given 1 piece of pumpkin.

Ordered the Mongolian Beef.....won't make that mistake again. They gave me more white rice than actual entree, the beef was overcooked and dry. They loaded up the entree with sliced carrots, which aren't even supposed to be in Mongolian Beef (description says peppers and mushrooms).

My son and husband still love the Pad Thai and their rangoons are pretty good. But, that is about all I can say is good here. They skimp on the veggies, the curry is kindof bland, their larb not good, hot and sour soup also bland. Sorry guys, time to find a new Thai restaurant.

I wish I could give it 3 and a half stars.  But I don't feel it's a 4, for sure.

Pros: Excellent, authentic Thai tea.   Service is very friendly.  Willing to accommodate special requests in your dish.

Cons:  Inconsistent quality.  And when you ask for level 1 spice out of 10, it will often be the same as when you ask for 5 or higher.  Very little chicken (which is usually tough) in the chicken curry, which includes more carrots than any other vegetable, but also includes green bell peppers, usually wilted/bitter/aging basil, and then the usual ingredients in that dish that you would expect.  Pad Thai flavor is good, but often the sprouts are old and getting slightly slimy/funky.  Chicken is a little dry and tough in this as well.
Spicy basil fried rice, oh how I love thee. Yellow curry, spicy papaya salad and yummy spring rolls, are all must have's. And they have a separate vegan menu. Score.

I usually don't eat at Thai Restaurants because everything is so sweeeeet and I can make it better at home.  But today, I tried TSNH and it was actually very good.  I did have to tell them to hold the sugar on everything.  I ordered Rad-na because I do not like to make this particular dish because it's too much work for me. My daughter had Spicy basil fried rice and (hold the sugar please!!)  it turned out delicious.  We will be going back as this place is pretty tasty!!!

Used To go to there Wynn location when I lived on that side of town.. When I moved and found out their other location was near by ... I was so excited. They have amazing food and can not get enough! One of the best tai places in Las Vegas. Prices are very responsible. My mother loves it and she is very critical.. Recommend it to everyone.
Great eats - homestyle thai food. Curries, noodles, noodle soups, and the lot. All tasty. Havent had a boring dish yet. Best part us that they deliver, too!

I was so excited to try their food, ordered for carryout, they verified my order when I picked it up but I got home and they made my tofu pad see ew with chicken.:( Dinner was ruined as I don't eat meat. Will not be going back.
Price is good, but service is not.  Needs more server during lunch/ dinner time.  And we don't need a male server with sagging pants.

Their appetizer fried wonton is the best! it has that zesty sweet taste to it which I love! I would say its the only thing i order from the appetizer menu. Haven't tried it yet?! i suggest you should!
Best Thai in town and somehow it's one of the cheapest too. Fantastic pot stickers. Love the spicy basil fried rice. Great service. Full scores across the board.

This a great spot for very reasonable prices and good sized portions. I had the pumpkin chicken curry which was delicate and flavored well and really good. My hubby had the spicy basil beef with wide pan fried noodles, which was good, but not as flavorful as mine. We split an order of chicken satay, which we both thought was over-seasoned and the peanut sauce lacking in flavor. I think we'll try again as the curry was so delicious. We asked for it spicy... a 7 of  10 for me i thought it was more of a 5... so kind of americanized. We thought it really worked if you were in the mood for thai, in a hurry and cheap eats.

Great food, great service, thanks Victor! We Left over-satisfied. Try the potstickers!!!    We had the yellow curry with chx, duck chowmein. Both way above average. Environment also above par. Thanks again!

First of all I was shocked that such amazing food existed in this area! So I was asked my buddy for a random place to eat to switch things up and keep in mind that most of the time I try new places, i never really find a satisfying place. Well this time I'm glad I founds this delicious restaurant! 
I tried their yellow pumpkin curry with the spice level at a 10 out of 10 & I have to say IT WAS THE BEST CURRY I've ever tried!!
I've had a lot before but this took the cake!
HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO EVERYONE!
love this place, my go-to thai restaurant. It's affordable and they're always friendly!

Five stars because I didn't even leave a noodle on my plate.  It was that good.  Gonna keep this review short and simple.  Excellent Thai food for cheaper than most other places in town.  For my first time, I tried the Pad Thai - my food mood was yelling at me to eat Pad Thai.  It was wonderful and the perfect combination of ingredients and spice.  I agree with some other reviewers that I wish there were a Thai Style Noodle House in Henderson!  Definitely recommend this place!

5 stars even though in a strip center- why?
It's all about the food and service. Fairly extensive menu caused worry about quality sacrifice. Ordered 4 different meals and everyone was really good without any repeating of style or flavor- served family style so all got  samples. Restaurant was not fancy but clean and tasteful. Service from Victor was excellent as he saw my parents unfamiliar with Thai dishes and took time to describe, ask about their taste preferences, but then tactfully left the table to our meals. All this including combo appetizer and one dessert (for Dad). Tab?......$50
The food is very good. I had the fried chicken and rice and it was incredible and its right around the corner from my house!

We ordered the Won Ton Soup and Prak Pi King which is the name they used for spicy green beans. The soup comes with fish cakes, pieces of pork loin, garlic chips, cilantro and bean sprouts.Both dishes were so good!! Highly recommend this place. The Pad See Ew is excellent, and  the combination beef soup is tasty and full of flavor because they use three different kinds of beef. The broth is probably made with beef bones but is really heavy broth. I have yet to try the Tom Yum Soup noodle. Thai ice tea one of the best I've tried. Excellent customer service and pleasant servers.  Place is about to celebrate its first anniversay next week. They do a lot of take out orders and free delivery if you live less than 3 miles. Will be here every week for sure since we live close by.

This restraint is one of the few that I like! My husband and I always come here for Thai food! The service is ok....bc I keep seeing new waitress every time I go there.  I liked the waitress that was there before but I never got to ask her name so....Another thing is that they've made the salad too spicy when I asked for mild and this happened few times now. I hope they will get that right next time.  We still like the food that we will keep coming here:)

I had gone in today for lunch and looked at their menu for their lunch specials. Not sure why they didn't just give the lunch special menu like they do at their 3rd location in Summerlin.
When you go for lunch be sure to ask for the lunch special menu. So much food! They currently have a 5.99 1 item combo with soup, rice and fried item. Add an additional item if you're hungry for 7.99. Their lunch menu encompasses a lot of choices from spicy eggplant to various curries. Mind you they don't do pad thai for the lunch special. But you won't miss it with all the other items they offer. And the prices can't be beat.
Best thai on this side of town for sure. Everything I've ever ordered was delicious and reasonably priced!

I was in the neighborhood & decided to try out the 2nd TSNH location, being that I am a fan of the original one ;) 

I ordered the Roasted duck noodle soup & some pineapple fried rice. 

The broth for the soup was a little sweet for me, but it was very good, especially after I added the spicy condiments ;) 

The Pineapple fried rice was just as awesome as at the other location. 

I had saved room for dessert & was looking forward to some fried banana with ice cream & honey, but alas, they were all out of bananas :( 

This location is probably as small as the other one, maybe slightly bigger. Very clean & friendly staff. 

I would definitely come back ;)

Actually went to this restaurant by accident thinking it was another Thai restaurant that I had researched earlier in the day. So many Thai restaurants on Fort Apache! Think they need to rename the street to Fort Thai. Anyways, the menu had a lot of choices but the one that stuck out for me was the duck curry. Two of my favorites duck and curry it was a no brainer. It was a really good first choice. Duck was tender and curry excellent with plenty of rice. Portion size wise I felt was perfect. Looking forward to going back and trying something else from the menu.

I just ordered to go from this place last night!! Amazing!!!! I love Thai food!!! The beef combination noodle soup was so good!! Even the flavoring of the broth had me drinking any left over soup. I also ordered the Papaya salad . Of course also amazing !! Best Papaya salad I've had. If you choose to dine in it is a small cozy place . Has the ma and pa shop vibe. The ppl that work there are super friendly too!! Must try!!
Horrible food. The server didnt even give us plates and forks. The duck fried rice is so disgusting.  It's so chewy and greasy. Worst food ive ever tasted.

Found on Yelp and the reviews are right. Very good Thai food with an extensive but not expensive menu. Fast service considering how busy they were. Lots of take out, lots of full tables and lots of Asians eating here.

Being a huge fan of Thai cuisine I was looking forward to trying Thai Style Noodle house. 

I unfortunately was not impressed at all. My order consisted of chicken satay, crab Rangoon and pad Thai chicken spicy. 

The chicken satay was made of chicken that had the texture of cardboard and was bland. The peanut sauce didn't do the satay any favors either. The crab Rangoon was ok, nothing special about it nor can I say it wasn't good. The sweat and sour sauce that came with it was watery. The main dish, the pad Thai chicken was mediocre. There is a distinct difference in pad Thai from a Chinese restaurant and pad Thai noodles from an authentic Thai restaurant, these favored Chinese, which was very disappointing. The spicy was rather weak and the chicken in the dish also had a cardboard taste.

Unfortunately, I would not return nor recommend this restaurant. On a positive, the host and server was very friendly!
Great place for a quick Thai fixin!  Love the friendly staff!  Kudos to Victor, La!  Always smiling, attentive, and friendly.  My fav dish is the "Chicken Noodle Soup with Flat noodles"

Tasty fish cakes, yummy curry, very reasonable pricing. The rad nar is lacking in the flavor department -needs garlic- and they tend to skimp on the coconut milk in the curry. It's a mystery as to why the noodle soups get cold so quick when eating there. Possibly the wide shallow dishes that are used for soup dishes. Papaya salad compliments any dish, especially meat dishes. Generous portions leave diners satisfied and for an additional charge; brown rice instead of white rice makes a great healthy choice. This is a delicious destination for foodies on a budget.
We love Noodle House#3 on Rampart n Lake Mead.  But At #2 is kind of disappointed.  It was salty and greasy. The service was ok.

This is great Thai food at a great price! Wonderful yellow and green curry! We also really like the house specialty potsticker appetizers. They deliver, which is also awesome! Just discovered it last week and already been back midweek for take out. :)

I have eaten here several times, and I tend to always get their Cashew Chicken.  My boyfriend tries different things and everything is always delicious.  The prices are extremely affordable, and the food is always so fresh.  The staff are very friendly, and we love coming to this restaurant or ordering pickup.  You can get 2 entrees plus an appetizer for about $20.  Can't beat that.  We've tried the other Thai places along Ft. Apache, and this one is our favorite!

Great food! I'm allergic to shell fish and some Asian restaurants use a fish sauce that contain shell fish or shrimp so I have to be super careful where I eat. I went in and asked about their fish sauce and they brought out a bottle and let me read the ingredients. The only "fish" was anchovy. That was super great that they did that. 
I only gave 4 stars because my yellow curry chicken and chicken pad Thai was skimpy on the chicken. 
Over all, two thumbs up!

Visited last night , beef panang curry not as good as first time . Yellow curry with chix and pumpkin really good .  Eggplant with chix very good same as last visit. Still a very good restaurant. Service very good.

Fantastic. The food was great. We were looking for something that wasn't China a No-No. We found the right spot. Orange chicken was perfectly crisp. Kids ate it up and no complaints. Not that Panda is worth comparing to but it is the kids choice and they usually complain when other Orange chicken doesn't taste right. We had a combo appetizer plate which was a great assortment. Thai chicken skewers were fantastic. Edamame was lightly salted and wonderful

Me had chicken curry and chicken pad Thai. Loved them both. We could have shared either dish because the portion size was nice. Not crazy large but a healthy portion. 

Although we didn't partake in desert they had a nice menu. Price was perfect. They don't serve fountain drinks. This usually annoys me but at 1.25 per can I spent less on drinks than any chain restaurant. I even had TWO cans!!!  

I think you should try this place.

I was starving after working for a bunch of hours at work. I was really craving  Asian food and my friend mentioned that he was getting Thai food. I rushed to Archie's since I LOVE their basil fried rice. It's amazing, but sadly they were closed. There are a bunch of Thai restaurants in this area, but this was the only name I remembered, so I decided to try it. I ordered Pork Pad Thai and Chicken fried rice. I ordered take out and my food came out pretty quickly. The service wasn't that great. Typically whenever I order to go, other places always offer me water, this place did not. They also did not offer me a place to sit. I just sat down. Maybe I just have different expectations? 

Their Pad Thai was weird. It was very dark and kind of clumpy. It wasn't horrible, but not the best I've ever had. My friend had Thai food from Weera Thai, and their Pad Thai was a lot lighter. I normally don't order Pad Thai, but I was starving and for some strange reason I wanted Pad Thai. The fried rice was pretty good. It just wasn't the same as I was looking for. I ordered a spice level of 7/10, and none of the dishes were spicy at all. I was worried that 7 would be too spicy, but it wasn't spicy at all! It was kind of disappointing, actually.

Came to eat here with my kids the other day, I am very critical of my Thai food since I have been to Thailand and have alot of Thai friends who cook authentic meals for me. Heard really good things about this place from coworkers so I figured I would try it out. I drove pretty far to check out this restaurant since I live on the opposite side of town but it was well worth it. It was a Saturday and I was greeted right away which is always a plus, we sat by the fish tank, it kept the kids occupied for awhile. I ordered the papaya salad, tom yum soup, pad see ewe , and bbq pork. The papaya salad was good but a little too sweet for my taste. Tom yum soup was delicious as well as the bbq pork. My kids liked the pad see ewe but to me it was just ok. I would actually only rate the food 3 1/2 stars but the reason it got 5 was the service was great. Our waiter was very nice and attentive, and he was able to comply to all my special requests (since my kids are picky). it usually is hard to find really good service in Asian restaurants because they usually hire people with no personalities and don't speak that much, and I was happy to have a waiter that could not only conversate and make me laugh but more importantly make my kids happy. It always makes life easier when they know how to handle kids and keep them happy so it makes it easier to enjoy my meal. Definitely will come back and bring my friends, hopefully my expectations will proceed me.

Probably my favorite go-to place for Thai food. Prices are very reasonable, the food is delicious, and they are very nice. My favorite dish there is the panang curry. 
This place is missing a star only because of my first time going there. But after giving them another chance, I love the place from there on. I was never served at all on my first visit. Waited to order for 20 minutes, even got there attention, but they ignored us and pretended that they didn't hear me.
But like I said that's all forgiven, everytime I get Thai food, I go here!

We eat here quite often. We love the food and the friendly service. We first went to  Noodle House 1 in China Town before 2 opened. This location is more modern and the room has a more fresh feel.

We love the lunch special menu, the pot stickers, the wonton fishball soup, the mixed veg entrée. It's all very good. We have never been disappointed.

I've been to this place for couple years already. It really disappointed me this time. Staff messed up my to go order, didn't call me back when she realized the mistake, didn't apologize when I called, only told me to go back again to exchange food. I was tired from working whole day and lived 10 mins driving distance away. It's extra 20 mins I had to drive to and from so I could have the right food. When I got there I  told the staff and owner (or owner's son) to either refund the money or do something. The owner refunded my money without apology or even eye contact.. The service is disappointed..

Casual, totally unpretentious - the place I go when I'm really hungry and I want hearty great Thai food at a great price.  Staff is friendly, and whatever I order, I'm never disappointed. Chet also serve a pumpkin curry that is to die for, and I don't see this item on menus of other Thai restaurants.  Hubbie agrees, we've never had a bad dish here.  And we've been here many times.

I'm giving it 2 stars for the service and quickness. Now for the food, we ordered the pad Thai and the pad se ew. The pad thai was a big clump of sticky gummy ramen like noodles you could barely chew let alone swallow, but the flavor was good they need a flatter noodle and the chicken was over cooked. The pad se ew had good flavor but the noodles were not wide the pork was tough.

I prefer the food at the corner Thai kitchen around the corner on trop.  Give it a try and please let me know what you think.  I jugde a Thai place on the pad Thai if they can make that well, you can bet the rest will be good too.

Absolutely delicious 2 item lunch special. I got kung pao beef and yellow chicken curry, spicy level #8! Comes w a huge dollop of white rice, smal cup of soup and choice of appetizer..I got a wonton..all for only #7.95! Plus, they are offering 7% cash back through Yelp..by signing up one of your credit cards..then, all you have to do, is use it there, and Yelp credits you back 7% of your bill. Highly recommended. Great flavors.

Really good, fresh, noodles and rice dishes. I have eaten there twice and had great food and service. They will prepare your order with the spiciness of your choosing. Have tried the egg rolls for appetizer, 2 styles of phad thai, and 2 style of thai fried rice. All were prepared just as we ordered. The egg rolls are so crisp! Cannot wait to try more items on the menu.
The curry with chicken and pumpkin was outstanding! Food was tasty and delicious. The service was five star!

Good food, great price, but HORRIBLE customer service. This is the only place I know that doest answer it's phone and then hangs up on you if you let it ring, then when you call back it's busy because it's off the hook.  Guess they are not trying to actually make money? Tired of this game as this happens at least once a week to us. I'm going down the street from now on.
Has become our favorite place! They deliver!!! Papaya salad and pot stickers are so amazing! I love the shrimp curry and pineapple fried rice! Always perfect and staff super friendly!

Seriously the rudest encounter of my life. They tried to give me half my food for full price and then when I asked if this was correct they fixed it with the most attitude possible. The foods good but the workers are not. Definetly never coming here again.
The cashier was rude dont have no since of humor, I don't think he knows whats customer Service is all about. I wouldnt recommend this place at all...

Love this place. Affordable, delicious & healthy food!! Plus the staff are nice. I usually order the yellow curry with a side of either flat or vermicelli noodles. You've to try that, it's sooo good! I've yet to try the entire menu lol. They have a separate vegetarian/vegan menu too which I love. It's easy to be vegan when the food is this good! Healthy vegan fast food!

We waited about 25 minutes to put in our drink order, then we both had straw paper in our water. The pad thai had very little flavor and the noodles were soggy. 
However the glass noodle soup was decent probably some of the top 10 noodle soups I've ever had. Probably wont be back.
Great service, great prices. I think the spicy scale is a bit of a scam as everything always seems hot, but no matter, we love this place!

Food is Excellent but the service is NOT! The gentleman taking the food orders acted like we were disturbing him.. Tried to give him the benefit of the doubt but this is the 3rd time we go and he's always beind rude and in a rush.

Since my hubby and I live right around the corner we decided to try this place. We were so glad we did! Before this, we always went to Archi's but since they've open we haven't been anywhere else for Thai food in the Vegas area.

They give big portions for great prices. Our favorites here are: beef larb, rad na, pad see ew, spicy egg plant (we can't eat too spicy so we opt for #3 spice) and most def the Thai ice tea. Did I mention they have a huge xl cup available for anyone who loves it? Service is always fast and friendly, even during their busiest hours.

I have ordered delivery from this place on a number of occasions.  To be fair, I have never been inside the restaurant itself so I cannot meaningfully comment on restaurant atmosphere etc.  To that extent, I cannot give the review more than a four and speak accurately.  Delivery is very timely and the people are friendly over the telephone.  Our order was well packaged and came to the house hot and fresh.

I have tried number of the dishes here and never been disappointed.  The drunken noodles with seafood combination is a spicy and savory dish that hits the spot.  I am a big fan of the curries here.  The red curry with seafood combination and the duck curry are excellent as well.  The soups are very delicious and sooth the body well if one is feeling sick or under the weather.  The spice level is appropriate as to what we have requested.  This has consistently been a good delivery food experience.

I look forward to visiting the restaurant in person soon.
I love the place simply because the food is very good for the price, its just that simple, not to mention Victor is my BOIIII...

Very good food for a great price. I had the fried chicken over fried rice. The chicken was not overly oily, crispy delicious coating. The Orange chicken was great too, no chunks of fat or chewy pieces. Great quality of food and friendly service!

Uh oh. Looks like things went downhill.. came in again and the wait staff was very rude upon arrival. The table we wanted was not ready which we had no issue waiting for. We were given an attitude when asked if we could sit there. When we asked nicely for water while our waitresd was wiping down the table, she actually IGNORED us. She seemed angry that we asked for the table to be cleaned and water. It was 95 degrees out. The real kicker was seeing the filth next to our table. I'll be checking out the other place nearby. Wanted this to be my go to.

Food is great, but their service is horrible, they show a lot of attitude, been to two of their
Locations - the one on Fort Apache and one on Spring Mountain Rd, at both the locations the food is amazing (as if the chefs making food are cloned :-)) , but both the locations the service is horrible, I visit to one on Fort Apache, food can't go wrong anytime - it comes fast and taste exactly as expected always, so is their service pathetic and with don't care attitude. Ex: Gives water with out straw you have to always ask for it and when you ask they give a strange look!! And once I asked for extra fork silver instead of plastic one and she says "we only have this", damn thing I could see silverware all around, they are usually busy and want to serve asap and get rid of you!

We come here all the time mostly because it's right by the house and it's reasonably priced! Staff is so nice and food is served so quickly! Our favorites are beef nam tok, pineapple shrimp curry, panang, papaya salad and tom yum.

My husband and I love this place. It's our go to place if we are craving Thai food. We love the dry noodle, it reminds us of our trip in Thailand & had the street food. I can go on & on with their delicious food, just try it yourself and you will not be disappointed.

Not good.

We ordered the chicken wings, pad thai, and pineapple fried rice last night.  The woman on the phone was very nice, and informed us the delivery would take about 45 minutes, since they were busy.  We were fine with this, unfortunately I can't say the same about the food.

The Pad thai showed up in a large clump of mushy noodles.  The flavors were all there, but the texture ruined the dish.  

The Fried Chicken wings had feathers on them.  Yes, feathers.  This should never happen, but clearly someone in the kitchen was rushing.  Either way, disgusting.

The Pineapple fried rice lacked the flavor many others have had, but it wasn't gross, just not very good.  It was on the light side which was nice, but still is not worth ordering. 

I'm not remotely interested in trying this place again, there are way too many Thai restaurants to settle for poor quality food.

Stopped by after getting a foot massage, which made me starving. It wasn't bad. The service was good. I have mixed feelings about the food. I got the yellow curry with chicken. It was really good, especially the potatoes in it. It was almost if they baked these pieces and then put them in the curry. They were different and tasty. I also got Som Tum and pork. This was just OK, especially the meat, which was a bit on the dry side and tasting slightly like liver. It came with two sauces and I preferred the one with vinegar rather than the sweet one although I'm not a big fan of vinegary tastes. The sticky rice that came with it was bad. It came in a bamboo container, I guess, to keep it moist. However, it was so tough, especially around the edges, that I didn't like it. I don't think it was supposed to be like this and that it was overcooked. I also didn't care for the bean-sprout type of salad. I'm not a fan of bean sprouts or having peanuts used in foods.
Everything is so delicious! They have a pretty large menu so you will forsure find something for you. They even have a vegan menu! I recommend their pad Thai and crispy tofu appetizer!

Super yummy! 
Best soups ever.. Fast take out, great to dine in as well. 
I found my new soup house.

Lent season = no meat. So what better place to grab shrimp dishes than a thai spot? 

And while I may opt for all the standard staple Thai dishes, I can also be very picky about them... and I was very impressed that they are all done very well at this 4 locationed restaurant throughout Las Vegas (Chinatown, Fort Apache, Rampart & S. Jones)!

RECOMMEND: 
- TOFU PAD THAI: Stir fried small rice noodles with egg, ground peanuts, bean sprouts in pad thai sauce. (I ordinarily would order this with chicken, if I could eat meat!)
- SHRIMP YELLOW CURRY: Coconut milk mixed with white onions, bell peppers, tomatoes & potatoes, with side of white rice. 
- SHRIMP PAD SEW: Stir fried flat rice noodles and egg with broccoli in sweet black soy sauce. (I usually prefer this dish with beef, but like I said, lent no meat fridays!)
- SEAFOOD WONTON SOUP: Wonton soup with seafood and yoo choy in clear broth. Add noodles to it for $0.75! 

Everything extremely satisfactory and hit the spot! Service was good, venue was nice, and the portions were filling! New to the southwest area and I think we officially found our go-to Thai place! :)

Have been here many times. I will never be back after the amount of time taken and no care if you wait. There were four people eating and I was the only person waiting. Soup took 30 minutes. When I expressed my concern no one cared. I DO NOT recommend. Zero stars in my book but you have to pick something.
4pm Saturday - Sold out of Noodle Duck, Floors and Chairs very dirty... Water taste like Chlorine.. WOW!  No more noodle house for this Team... Approved by JKKUHL LLC.
My now favorite thai place.. I really enjoy there thai spicy basil & there egg drop soup

If you're looking for something cheap and decent, this place isn't bad. We ordered fried tofu, calamari, duck curry, salmon avocado curry, chicken noodles. We all asked for medium spicy and most of our food wasn't spicy at all except for the noodles which was really spicy  ( my friend looked like he was in a hot yoga class while eating it, I personal tried it and it was on the very spicy side) we had to add rice to it and even with that, it was still very spicy.
Fried chicken over fried rice, duck fried rice, thai spicy noodles and yellow curry are all great!  The pad thai was OK.  Big servings for the price you pay.

Nice little hole in the wall with delicious and authentic Thai food. How do I know it's authentic? My bf and I usually get the runs - IN A GOOD WAY because of the spice, not because of food poisoning, lol. Everything is incredibly affordable and well portioned with noodle dishes around $7 and specials around $8-9. I particularly enjoyed their special beef noodle soup, kuay kai seafood rice noodles, BBQ pork w/ papaya salad and sticky rice, and their pork larb. I would definitely stop by again if I'm ever in the area.
Hands down the best Thai food in Vegas. The service was on point, the place is clean and again the service was excellent.

Great place, great food.  Can make anything Vegan but you have to tell them.  They use a special button on cpu that says vegan.  I like that.  Means no fish sauce and egg.  Very nice, comfortable dining area.  Fast and friendly.
Food is just ok but the services is very very bad. 2 waitress just keep talking to each other we ask for one more white rice it's never come. I will never come back to this place.
Been coming here a while and I'm always treated nicely by all the workers. They're always smiling no matter what. Never had a bad service.
Good Thai food on the cheap. The only thing I dont like is their chairs at the Fort Apache location. They are worn out and sunken in. Very uncomfortable.

This is our 2nd or 3rd time eating here. Always good service & food. We enjoyed the calamari, Larb, and pad Thai - deliciousness! I also like the menu is affordable. If you enjoy Thai food, you won't be disappointed!
GREAT CURRY! yummy pot stickers and pad thai. like the new location further from the strip.
You get what you pay for. If you're looking for a cheap Thai Spot here you go! Bright side is they offer XL Thai Tea for $3.

Great food and incredible value!

I discovered this place via Yelp and was so excited when they opened this location closer to my home!  

We frequent this place and I've tried most of the more appealing items on the menu.

Must haves:

Coconut Water!  Try it!  It's sweet with chunks of coconut right in the glass.  Surprisingly good!

Thai style pot stickers...quality deep fried dumplings, but with a kicker.  Three different sauces on top.  Believe it or not, makes all the difference.  Amazing!

Grilled beef or pork salad.  Thai style salads are great!  Crunchy and tasty, TSNH makes one of the best.  It's a great combination of meat and veggies and priced well for the size too.

Roasted Duck Noodle Soup.  Sweet and plentiful.  You can choose your noodles, so I usually pick the thicker rice noodles and add wontons for extra heartiness.  Sweet broth goes perfectly with the duck and it's filling and good!

Tom Yum  Noodle Soup.  My friend's favorite!  Coconut base with a spicy bite.  That sweet and sour flavor is unmistakable and again, big portions, hearty and filling!

Khua Kai.  I compare this to it's chinese counterpart of fried rice noodles, but they serve it with a side of duck sauce that makes the thai version just a hair better.  Pretty simple dish, fried with scallions and egg with soy sauce, but when you mix it with the duck sauce...it's a perfect match!

Duck fried rice.  The duck adds a moist, more tender meat than your typical chicken, beef and pork.  Add that to a definite thai style of fried rice here, and it's just great fried rice!

Mangos with sweet sticky rice.  I grew up on sticky rice and this dessert runs $6 at the thai place down the street!  It's the same thing and always tastes better when it's less expensive!

Let me start by saying I was a fan.

I have been to both locations. I stopped going to the other because of sanitary reasons. I saw the dude cooking on the wok sneeze in to his hand, then continue cooking. I asked the waitress and she said, "no he did not" ... OK ... gross.

Then here ... previously, cheap and decent Thai food.

Until this week. Ordered food ... it came, the pot sticklers which are usually excellent were dripping grease and covered/swimming in sauce. Not a good start. The soup and salad came, and so did a little friend walking across the floor.  Actually not so little. A roach in the middle of the dining room. When I went to the manager/cashier about it, she said they have no problems - they spray all the time. I said then what about the roach in the middle of the restaurant, she said it must have come from outside. (After leaving the business, not one roach, anywhere.) I find this very hard to believe when on previous experience I had health concerns with their other location - in fact, I just learned the other location was temporarily closed by the Southern Nevada Health District last month. I think it is time for an inspection of this location as well.

For what it is worth, I offered to pay, I kept asking how much do I owe you - I kept asking, again, kept asking - yet she was on a very long conversation in Thai (I assume with an owner) about the roach issue. She did not make me pay, which in all honesty is what should have been offered in the beginning, since we did not eat and we were interrupted by pests.

I normally go to the original Noodle House, but Noodle House 2 is a lot closer to my house so I thought I'd try it out. 

The inside of this one is so much nicer. More spacious, more modern, and there's actually a waiting area when the restaurant is full. 

The menu is the same as the original, which I was happy to see! I ordered what I usually get (beef and broccoli) at the original house to compare it to this one. My BF ordered a combination bowl with small rice noodle. Both of the dishes weren't as good as the original house, but they weren't bad either. It was almost as if they both tasted more bland. 

The servers were very nice. One of them was so engaged with his customer they were talking about boxing almost the whole time we were eating... Lol. (Go Manny!!!)

Overall we enjoyed our experience and really liked the restaurant inside!
Pad see eww and green curry fried rice are great! I can substitute my crave for Sanam Luang (in SoCal) with food from Thai Style Noodle House!

I decided not to go here again because of the lady with her service.  Never really pleasant with her every time.  finally had enough when i asked for light ice with my Thai ice tea and she told me that's extra.

Very good food, fast service, great prices. The Thai specialty drinks are cheaper than at other places. Nice inside, friendly service, no debit card limit of $15 anymore (great bc I don't carry cash). 

My favorites are the papaya salad, basil fried rice, and pad Thai. I'll keep coming back happily! :)

*** update I have now been harassed 2 times by profiles the owner instead of trying to make it right is now sending foul messages to me directly. *** I have been to this location many times and I have to say I usually enjoy anything that I order and usually the service is amazing but today I went in and ordered my usual broth and was met by complete rudeness. By only a person that I can assume is the owner. he is a man that I have never seen her before but it seems like he rather be anywhere else but running his business. The fact he was demeaning to his staff on top of it made me say scratch my order and I will never order or put money into the pockets of such an a**hole.

What can I say?  Great thai food and great prices.  I ordered the pad kee mao, papaya salad, and the spicy basil beef/ chicken.  Friendly people and I am so glad they are opening another one up on Jones and Warm springs!  Win!  I love this place and for the price, it's a must try.

I love this restaurant. This place is right by my house so it's a very convenient location. First of all the food is really good, I always order the beef ball noodle soup (similar to pho) and the fried snapper with chili sauce, which is absolutely to die for. Their Thai iced tea and appetizers are delicious as well. 5 stars for good food and great service.
Love this place, been going there since they opened.. Cheap and the food tastes good. Love the spicy basil chicken, spicy string beans, and the yellow curry.

People are friendly soon as we walk in they greeted us, place is kinda clean I think they need to change the chairs it's kinda dirty already. Food was good we ordered beef combination and parang curry both were good definitely would be back to try the other menu they have to offer, price is pretty decent the also have lunch special ranging to 8.95  the place is easy to find near a barber ship. The compound itself has a lot of store.
this my favorite thai take-out place in vegas bc it's delicious, SO CHEAP !!!!!, and quick.
Great food and flavors with authenticity...To top it off great prices. My fav's are lard-na, pad thai, beef noodle soup. Great place to satisfy your cravings for Thai food.

I love this joint! Food feels like a warm hug on a cold winter's night. Always comforting to know they are just around the corner when I am craving the noodle house. I always order the chicken noodle soup with flat noodles.

Foods are good. But the male server( with glasses)  has terrible service. We've been there three times, the same server same terrible service. Won't really say a word to us. Only word he said was " you done?" Female server was totally different. Would come to us ask if everything ok. Has very friendly smile. Never go there eat again if the male server still works there.

THREE WORDS: QUANITY FINALLY MEETS QUALITY ( Ok, FOUR words!) lol But FINALLY, i don't have to take a journey down to the east side of Las Vegas to get some authentic and savory thai cuisine. I work nearby and i must say i eat here at least twice a week and even on my days off.
The Portions are far generous and the quality definitely exceeds my expectations. Bursting with flavor their dishes will take anyones taste buds for a ride. Anyone LOVE papaya salad LAOS style?? Get it here, is is BOMBDOTCOM. The Rad Nah, pad see ew, and pad thai are also amazing, but one of my favorites is the chef's special pineapple curry.! & the LARGE thai tea which is Gi-normous is only $3.00. Major two thumbs up from me.!

I called for a pick up order only to drive there and find out that that their credit card machine is broken and that it's cash only. I didn't have any cash so I just left with no food, wasted gas and the worst part of it was that they didn't even apologize about the fact that they didn't tell me on the phone that it was broken before I drove there. Also I asked them why didn't tell me on the phone that the machine is broken and they basically just looked me at and said nothing with and "oh well " face. If I just wasn't so hungry I wouldn't have came back, so I brought cash with me and they tried to hand me the old curry I ordered had to ask them to make it fresh for me and looked mad about it. Ridiculous!!
I come here for their chicken pad see ew and panang curry. The prices are lower than most Thai restaurants but the food is delicious and the portions are big.
Love love love this place! I always get their Shrimp Pad Thai at level 5! Such a good portion just wish they would add more peanut crumbs!
Love their food! Their prices are also incredibly low for the quality of the food. Highly recommend!

My boyfriend placed 2 orders of fried calamari to go, and when we got home I was so upset. What we got today in two boxes equals the amount of food we were served with one order the previous week. So disappionting!  There're only probably 10 pieces in each box :(
Love love love love love!!! I'm a creature of habit so I always get the pan nang curry with chicken and sticky rice. And I like it hot! Owner is super nice too

Ordered the pineapple fried rice with fried tofu, added-on brocolli, and no egg for yummy vegan meal. Highly recommend, but if you want it to be spicy, I suggest level 9-10. Asked for a level 7 and it was really mild!
Great food and great service. The crab fried rice is the best. If you looking for a great Thai food, this is the place to go.
We have been looking for a good Thai place close to home.  The food and service was excellent!

I always order this through uber eats and the portions are giant for the price. It's always super hot, fresh, and delicious. I've ordered Thai through other places that aren't nearly as good for what you pay. The pad Thai and Tom kha soup are two of my faves!

After going to another Thai Restaurant and paying $12 for Pineapple Fried Rice, I was shocked with how cheap the prices were here. Around $7 for a big box of my favorite fried rice, and it tastes amazing? What more could you possibly ask for?

While I'm still a little weary to try other menu items, I did order the Mango Sticky Rice after reading a few good things about it here on yelp -- and it's actually really, really good. I was a little afraid how rice and fruit would mesh together, but it's tasty without being too sweet.

Clean looking restaurant, great tasting food, and I love how inexpensive it is.

First time out was a winner - ordered the appetizer combo, all were good if fairly standard, but the chicken satay was amazing, I could have made a meal of it. I wanted to try the soups but they stop serving them at 9:30. Also had the chicken/shrimp with silver noodles & the khua-kai rice noodle with egg and chicken, both were great, flavorful but not overloaded with sauces or spices so I could taste the food. Def a place I'll keep in mind when the next Thai food jones hits. Check it out.
By far my favorite Thai place! I would eat here once a week if I could! Service isn't the best but I don't mind I go there for the food!

Great food....horrible customer service. It took 10 mins to get water. I had to ask them to take my order. And when waitress was ready she made a smart comment about not taking my order because my phone was out.
Love their Spicy Eggplant with ground beef spicy level 10, however they don't have chilly in fish oil oh well I got mine at home.

Most recent visit was disorganised and disappointing. The food here is tasty but the portion size for the price is daylight robbery. First time having my favorite Glass noodle salad here but it was overly salty and had barely any noodles, mostly cilantro, onions and romaine. This dish is bigger AND better at Panna down the street. Our waitress was rushing us to order even though there was only one other table. Then our main dishes came out separately so two of us were eating while the others were still sitting 20 mins without food. We asked to cancel the orders because it was taking too long and we had to get back. The waitress kept telling us the food was almost ready but we'd lost our appetite and our time at this point. She was quick to take our payment however. Smh.
Very average thai restaurant. Average quality food and poor service. Lotus of Siam is much, much better.

We had the sampler appetizer platter. The bbq chix skewers were.very good . I would def get that by itself next time. If there is. The rest were meh. We also had the pad see ew. That was also good although lacked any spice and some salt.. We asked for medium . We also got the beef larb. I ve eaten quite a bit of this dish at many Thai places and I also used to work at a Thai rest. Their larb is nothin. Like anything it's suppose to be. Maybe they forgot how to make it that night? It was just chopped up big chunks of beef . With some lemon juice. No mint no rice powder nothing . And mind u they threw so much red pepper flakes in it that I know for a fact they over spiced it . It had red all over . But they didn't correct it. Poor customer service on their end . I just didn't eat it.
 The good : prices. 
The bad: service and quality .

This place is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. My favorite is shrimp pad Thai with a 5 for the spicy level. The price is pretty good for the quality of the pad Thai! I have tried the green curry and the red curry. I love them both! Definitely not a 5 star restaurant but I would give it 4 stars! !

Now that I moved back to this side of town, I will be coming here a LOT more often. I love the choice of foods and how you can customize your noodle entrees!!

Absolutely gotta try the Roasted Duck Noodle soup!! I get this almost every other time I go~ I've never ordered anything here that I didn't like.

There are four Thai Style Noodle House restaurants in Las Vegas. This is the second one. I have to say the place is clean and the food is very good. However, the service has a lot to be desired! When we arrived, the restaurant only had a few patrons. When we sat down we had to wait a bit for our drink orders(no big deal). When our drink and food orders were taken the waiter was not at all friendly. My meal came after about 10 minutes, I was given no extra plate, condiments, or napkins.The waiter then took a seat and finished his meal. My son's meal did not arrive for ten more minutes. Not once were we offered more soda or water. After we finished we asked for the check. The older woman handed it to me with out a thank you or a smile. We have been here several times and these two servers are EXTREMELY RUDE! How pathetic to dislike your job so much. I will not be back, I will just take my business elsewhere!

I came here on a sunday to have a date with me, myself and I, and I was dying of hunger. Okay, well not exactly dying, but I was super hungry, since I didn't eat anything that day.  Anyways, onto the review:  

I was immediately greeted and seated seconds after walking in, then asked what I would like to drink.  I received my water and ordered larb with regular rice, and calamari with sweet sour sauce. Now I loved how much 'meat' you get with the calamari, but I didn't like the sweet and sour sauce paired together. I liked the larb, but not 'in love' with the larb because it was drowned in sauce that it was getting harder to eat towards the bottom of the plate. 

Towards the end, I had to stop a server for a box, and normally when one does that you receive a check.  I received my box and put my leftovers away, while waiting for a check.  I waited another minute or two and realized the server was just talking with another server that I had to interrupt her.  Other than that, it wasn't so bad. I'm willing to go back.
I ordered for the first time and chose the pad thai thinking it would be the safe choice. I didn't think it was all that great. It was edible but I wouldn't want to order from here again

I decided to take my sister here as she suggested Thai food and I did not want to go down to Chinatown or even near there.  We were pleasantly surprised.  I couldn't believe the pricing for the amount of food we got.  The staff was very attentive.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and will be going back.
Each and every time we go the food is super good, nice and hot and generous helpings! Staff nice and friendly and restaurant clean!

Food here is good.  Sometimes the food is a little off though when you tell them the spice level you want.  If you order a 4 spice level one day may be like a level 7 spice level another.   All in All, I just like their duck dishes and the beef noodle soups.  You can't really get it at some of the other Thai places.  If you're not a duck person or a Thai noodle soup person, then I would try places like Archi Thai's Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice is way better.

It's been YEAAARS since I ate at this location and it's still good! I used to go to the Wynn location a lot back in the day, but this one seems newer. This location has been open for a long time now and it still looks like a good environment to dine in. As far as food quality goes the two locations I've been to seem to have the same taste. They have never disappointed me as far as their food, but the real take from this place are the prices. Everything is pretty cheap and they give great portions! My girlfriend and I were able to share an order of pad Thai noodles and beef jerkey. She also got an order of their thai tea. We spent less than $20. I remember I used to get their BBQ combo you find on the back of the menu. It comes with sticky rice and papaya salad. That was always my go to. The servers were welcoming and I can tell they've gotten to know a lot of the regulars there. I forgot how good this place was for a quick thai fix. Definitely will be back.
Two days in a row, we ate and ordered different food items and the taste is really great!  Authentic Thai food for a cheap price!  So worth it!

Clean, delicious food, shared crab fried rice, I had chicken noodle soup, my wife had the beef soup, both were really good lots of meat and noodles, very reasonable price for the amount of food and the quality of it. Great service. We will be back!

My first time having curry and it was amazing! The lady was very accommodating to my request and every time I go there (they definitely had my boyfriend and I hooked after first time) she is really nice and helpful! This is my forsure go to place from now on!

How would I describe Thai Style noodle house? Well, take one hand open it up and place something of outstanding quality there, then take the other side of your hand and also place something of really good quality there but A LOT of it, then CLAP your hands together! Aside from Hercules Hercules! What do you have? The meeting of QUALITY and QUANITY! Innovative I know, but that is exactly how I would describe this place they serve up plates and plates of delicious food and you get A LOT of it!

 I have yet to be disappointed each time of come here and have explored a vast majority of the menu! Must tries are their pad Thai, duck fried rice, chicken panang, basil beef, basil fried rice and if your LAO or prefer the Lao style papaya salad rather than Thai, they have the best LAO Style papaya salad! Super great location and awesome prices. Service is also stellar. Recommended for all your savory Thai cravings!

The very first place I came to eat at when I first moved to Las Vegas.  I was impressed by the quality of food, and service.  I have come here numerous time over the past few months.  My favorite dish is the Yellow Curry, and I think their coconut juice is some of the best I've ever tasted (ice cold, served with a spoon to eat the baby coconut).

I love love love this place. If they were closer to my house I would probably frequent this place more then once a week.

It's hard to find a good Thai place that cooks their food like my moms style but here they do and I struck gold because my mom now lives in Tennessee so this was the best substitute. 

Every time I come here I want to order everything on the menu but always get the Crispy Pork belly fat with Chinese broccoli about $8.95 plus a single side of rice. Their 3 companion dish hits close to home with the BBQ pork, papaya salad and sticky rice is perfect and reminds me of what my mom would make all the time. A lot of their other dishes are absolutely delicious and the dessert sound and looks amazing I yet have to try that. 

Food is amazing, price is awesome and restaurant is clean and quaint. The staff is also very nice. I would return to the place everyday of I could. If you haven't been here you must do just that because you will be hook at first bite.

Not bad for the price. Ordered pad se ue, pad Thai and yellow chicken curry. The curry wasn't thick at all but the taste was good. And the other two were good but I've had better. If u want lower priced Thai food this is a good place.
I always order from here when I'm hungover lol I get usually a mix of things. But I always, always get the beef salad level 7! My favorite!!!

This is the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.

Try these:
Lad Nah noodles
Papaya salad
Grilled pork
Pad Se-Eu
Hoi Toad

I like reviewing places for the purpose that they serve, so they don't necessarily need orgasmic, revolutionary food just to garner a full 5 stars.  This place is good and cheap- great for what it is.

Interior is what it is too, nothing super splendid but not shabby either.  They have the Thai channel on as you wait for your food, which can be entertaining at times to see the monkey dancing and other oddities.  Service is fine- quick and attentive.

But their food..  very, very nice.  There was only one other place in Vegas that had bigger portions of pad thai, but that place closed down.  Whomp whomp.  I've tried plenty of their dishes and it's only when I tasted their praram dish that I had to write a review.  It's a stir fry of vegetables and any choice of meat, topped with peanut sauce.  To my, peanut sauce is like an aphrodisiac, and this dish had PLENTY.  So.  Good.

I went here with a friend and I've been returning with more friends ever since.  I'm always hungry late night so an hour or two before they close, if I'm feeling hungry, I'll stop by the place and get something quick.

All other Thai places nearby are way too expensive for what they're putting out- if you're craving it and are in the area, you gotta stop by.

Food was great! Prices were great! Customer service? HORRIBLE! Waitress had a horrible attitude when asking for an extra sticky rice for our daughters. She never even brought it out. Never came to refill our drinks. Just bad service.

Favorite Thai restaurant by far.  Same great prices as the Wynn location in Chinatown, but much nicer dining area inside.  Staff is always friendly.  Food is always amazing and prices are phenominal...reminiscent of great Thai places I used to eat at in Seattle.

My roomie and I walked in around 3pm on a Friday afternoon. We were told we could choose our own seating, cool.

I ordered the Hot and Sour special soup with flat noodles. My roomie ordered the spicy basil fried rice with beef. The Hot and Sour soup was not as flavorful as I had thought it would be. It was definitely sour, though. The soup comes with multiple meats but my favorites were the ground chicken and pork (everything else was eh). I'm giving this place 4 stars because I ended up enjoying my roomie's fried rice more than I liked my own meal. 

Maybe next time I'll try something different. Will come back with hopes to be proven wrong about future dishes.

Just as good as the first one.
I'm glad this place is the same because nothing needs to change.
I love coming here for a quick bite to eat because I'm never disappointed and the service is relatively quick.
And their Thai Tea is still on point.
As with the original Noodle House, I wish it were a little bigger.
I've never seen the place crowded or have a wait but I just feel a little cramped whenever I'm inside.
I guess they're just keeping it old school.

This place is great. We were in the area and my girll suggested we try this place for lunch. As an official fan of Thai food, I was on board. The curry and noodles were perfect. Delicious and spicy. My favorite combination. I will definitely be back and because of their great prices, I can often.
The basil chicken w rice, excellent! The pot stickers excellent! Thai tea good. . I love good thai. This was my first time here , I'll be back

I may not be the best to read a review from because I order the same thing every single time.  Yellow curry with chicken, no potatoes, no potatoes and extra chicken.   I think it's some of the tastiest yellow curry around.   Plus the prices are very solid (I think my meal is like $8).   Most places are at least a few dollars more for the same thing.  They are weak with the spicy.  When they ask what level of spicy I want from 1 to 10, I always say 20 and tell them I want it really really really hot.   To the point that I'll cry from the heat.   And maybe one out of 8 times it's as insanely spicy as I want it.   It's always tasty though.   As always they give not nearly enough rice as you need (but no Thai place does) so I just make more at home and usually turn my dish into 2 meals.  

I usually choose take out but sometimes I eat in.  The service isn't too great.  They get the waters to you pretty quickly and take your order fast but you hardly see them after they bring you your food.   Slacking on the water fill up a little usually but it's all good with me.   I'll go up to the counter if I need something which is slightly inconvenient.  

The place is modern and clean on the inside from what I can see (their chinatown location is pretty gross, I wouldn't eat there) but I never got a gander into the kitchen.   I've had the beef pad-see-ew (probably bad spelling) and thought it was a nice portion and tasty.   

If they could step up the spicy and have better service Id give them 5 stars.   If you want quality, nice portions, tasty and a respectable price point, give this place a try.
Love this place, come here at least once a week for the Noodle House Tom Yum, and get it super spicy. Then chase the heat away with a thai tea.

LOVE this place. But then again I LOVE thai food, sooo flavorful!!! Tried a few other thai restaurants in town nd this one is mos def the place to come back again and again!! Tom Ka soup is one that everyone has to try! The ground pork fried rice hmnnm yumm. Just commenting on the restaurant makes me want it for dinner. The waittress was so attentive. Small but friendly and delicious place!! MUST TRY!!

My go to place for authentic and delicious Thai food! This place is so good! I used to go to Archi's for thai food but after discovering Thai Style Noodle House, I have not stepped foot in the former. It's also a plus that this place is right next to my house. There is another Thai Style Noodle House location in chinatown but this one is about a 5-7 minute drive from my house. The portions are pretty generous for Thai food. If you eat a lot of Thai food, you'll know that the servings area always tiny. This place is the total opposite. The plates are always full and very affordable. ~$50 could feed my whole family (4) with left overs. Another reason I love this place is because it's very family oriented. Everyone here is really nice and they're always coming around to make sure everything is alright even though it's always packed when I go. It's nice to see how attentive they are, especially since their staff is very small.

My favorite dish here is the Pad See Eu with beef. MMM. I am salivating just thinking about it! A second favorite is the spicy eggplant with tofu. I usually get the spice level at a medium so it's not too overpowering. The duck fried rice is a good option too! Oh and don't forget the squid salad, potstickers, and last but not least... the mango sticky rice! It is absolutely AMAZING!! I could go on and on about the different food items that I love here. The only thing i wasn't a fan of here was their thai iced coffee and thai iced tea. They were good but a little too sweet for my taste. Not a big deal though. I can't wait to come back here for a feast!

Oh yeah, they also do delivery but I believe it's only within a 3 mile radius.

Definitely my go to Thai place in vegas. This place is definitely budget friendly and the food is on point. Their staples of pad see ew, Tom yum, Tom Kah, mint leaf beef, and currys are all good. From their chef specials the ginger snapper with crispy fish is a good choice when you don't want meat, and their mootod is this crispy pork that has this citrus salty jalapeño  dipping sauce is yummy. I have pretty much tried everything on the menu and it never disappoints.. when they do have mango sticky rice in season that's always a great way to end your meal here. Oh and if you live close by they deliver!

Service was great, and our waitress was very friendly. But, the food was alright. We ordered the pineapple fried rice, chicken satay, duck curry, and yellow curry. The chicken satay portions were small and it wasn't that flavorful. The pineapple fried rice was very oily and greasy and didn't really have a pineapple flavor to it, but the chicken and cashews they added to it helped. The chicken curry was my favorite, it had a lot of flavor and the portions for the curry were quite big. A bowl of rice came with the chicken curry. We ordered mild spice for the curries, but it was a little spicy. Place was small but, a lot of families were coming in and out to eat dinner, so it's a good place to eat with family or a large group.

Went here because of the reviews.  Normally go to David Wongs whenever I crave fried rice.  But since he went on vacation, I needed to find an alternative.

Went here with friends, knowing up front that service was subpar, but also expected the food to make up for it.  The consensus between friends is that this place deserves 1 star because the food doesn't come anywhere close to our favorite spot.  And the service was lack luster.  

I encourage anyone who thinks this place is the bomb, give David Wong's 1 chance.  You will thank me later.

This place is really going bad. Its cheap but the food not that good especially the pad thai.. it tastes sour. We used to come here often but everytime we go, the food keep getting worst. I keep saying give it a try again and looks like its just doesnt taste as good as the first time we came here. Well I guess you get what you pay for. Even if its cheap its not worth the money. Still surprise alot of people still give it 5 satrs.

I was in the mood for something fast and more on the healthy side, so I ordered take out from here last night by phone. The lady who took my order was neutral but courteous, and she repeated my order correctly without me asking. I ordered the Khua-Kai rice noodles, Beef Basil fried rice, the Choo-chee Chicken Curry, an order of potstickers, and two Thai teas. Everything turned out to be good and tasty, especially the Curry! I didn't even notice that the Basil Beef I ordered came with the rice on the side instead of everything fried together...actually I just thought of it now, so it was obviously that good! The potstickers came with a few sauces drizzled on top, which was nice because it was already prepared. Also, I usually order the Thai tea without ice, so it doesn't get diluted and when I get home I dilute the tea with some of my own tea because it is really, very sweet and I get a few more glasses out of it. 

I would prefer to dine-in because I think they are more generous with the portions as opposed to how much they serve with take out. However, it was still filling, delicious, and not so heavy! Everything was also affordable at just under $37. And at the end of this dinner, you don't feel like you undid your entire week of working out on just one meal :)
I go here for work lunches all the time. They are quick and the food  is delicious. There are a few options for Thai food in close proximity and this is my favorite.

So I was very disappointed with TSNH especially when it had a 4 star rating.  But then again I noticed other having missed opinions about this place also.  I didn't have high expectations going in, since this was Plan B for dinner, so that's probably the only reason why I didn't give them a 1.

First off there was something wrong with the service, I don't know, it was the most MEH experience I've ever had.  The lady who served us only smiled once and this was when it was time to pay, as if she was only happy to see money. We all ordered water maybe that added to why we got that service.

The food we also received were complete opposites from what I've seen on the pics and what was described in the reviews.  One of the dish we ordered was the yellow curry.  The flavor in the curry was decent but there were very little ingredients.  It was mostly sauce and it was very watery.  Another dish we ordered was the chow mein, the noodles were dry and it was all very salty. And another was the fried chicken, HORRIBLE don't ever order this, it was rubbery and tiny like microwaved chicken.

I don't know maybe I went on bad night or they just sensed that this was my Plan B for dinner.  I probably won't be back.

Only giving it 2 stars because of the service. Food is always good here, but this was the first time we dined inside. We arrived around 9:20p and the place closes at 10p. There was 2 other tables in the restaurant when we arrived. When we sat down they gave us 2 minutes to look at the menu and asked if we were ready and we asked for another minute. An older lady approached us twice after that asking if were ready and the second time around she said kitchen is closing so we have to order. We ordered 2 apps and 2 entrees. Entrees came out first and then the apps. You could tell they were rushing. After we got all the food they immediately dropped the check. She made a comment "take your time" so we tried to finish eating and they kept stopping by to see if the check was ready. When my boyfriend gave her his card she dropped the check back off and said "sign it so I can close it out." Overall the food was good but the service was rude. 7/1 dine in date & there was 1 older & 1 younger woman working. Should close at 9:30 if you're going to rush the kitchen but you say you close at 10.

So this place is really close to the house. It's a really  small place that's family oriented. The people were friendly and attentive. First time being here and will definitely will be returning. They have great take out available and you also get it delivered.

I love Thai food. I admit I was not a foodie until I met my girlfriend and one of my favorite cuisines now is Thai. I am convinced that there is no better restaurant than Kung Fu Thai, but I am always happy to keep searching. This place was good and more than that, it was surprisingly cheap. My FAVORITE was the papaya salad...oh, my, god. I was craving it the next morning and I will definitely be returning to this place. The reason for four stars instead of five was because when we walked in we noticed a sign that said debit card machine was not working. All we had was a debit card so we asked before we sat down. No one had any idea if the machine was back up LOL. All they said was 'i dont know' then walk away. Maybe I was just hangry but that really annoyed me. The food made up for it though. Try this place.

We ate lunch today and once again no lunch menu offered to us. Not sure why a place would have a lunch menu and not give it to guest. They know us but still don't give it to us. I posted it in the picks. Anyway make sure to ask for the lunch menu because the price is much better.

I love this place for take out. My go to order is the Crab fried rice and pad see ew! The portions are generous and the prices are awesome. 

Whenever I crave Thai I'd stop by to pick up something quick for the fam. They also have cash back on yelp, which gives you a few bucks off every time you dine with them- which is pretty sweet.

We've eaten here multiple times! The chicken pad Thai is to die for!!! The mild is a little spicy but it is so good! We also get the Gyoza and it is perfection! They are not the regular "dip in sauce" gyozas. They have sauce drizzled over the top of them and it just makes the whole meal! 

We had it delivered for the first time tonight and my mans exact words were "he loves his job!" The delivery driver was happy and got the food to us in great condition! Warm and all in place! We love the Thai House!!!

Came in for lunch yesterday. A lady quickly pointed out a table for us to be seated.

Ordered the Seafood Tom Yum Rice Noodle Soup in mild. I didn't wait long before it was brought out to me. Love the soup (sour and spicy) and there was tons of it (couldn't even finish drinking it all). Seafood included slices of fish cakes, shrimp, mussel, and fish balls. It would have been perfect if they threw some mushrooms in there. 

Service was alright. Took a long while before they even brought out my husband's lunch. And when they did, they didn't bring him anything to eat it with. Had to ask for the condiments as well since there was none on our table.  

This seem to be the only Thai restaurant in the surrounding area. Not the best Thai food I ever had but will do when it comes to satisfying that sudden Thai craving.
This is my favorite Thai restaurant at this time! Great prices, food has amazing flavor and the portions are on point. Definitely a go to when you're in the mood for Thai food!

One of the best bangs for the buck in the Las Wegas!  No that's not a typo even though there currently is a red squiggly telling me to fix that.

Thai beef salad, if you were a woman, I would compare you to Paris Hilton... you are cheap and delicious!!  

Side of fried rice, damn you I can't stop eating you!!!!!

I have nothing else for you, this restaurant is the bomb, it has multiple locations, that's how good it is, people just can't have it one spot.

I come in at least once a week. My favorite is their combination beef noodle soup. I've tried other dishes as well like the spicy basil beef,  spicy eggplant, and spicy string bean to name a few. They were great. I would recommend this place for their good food and value.

Thai house 2 has been my go to place for fast inexpensive Thai food. It's less crowded than the one on Spring Mt., both are great and customer service is the only thing that's inconsistent. But overall food is always good. We've tried everything on their menu and all was good.

Cheap, fast and tasty - and you don't have to settle for two out of three.

We had duck noodle soup (I didn't get a taste, my daughter became quite defensive after her first bite), orange chicken and red curry with pumpkin and chicken.  Orange chicken was the bomb!  Tangy, crispy, and light - the breading enhanced the flavor rather than acting as filler.  Red curry was marvelous, with carrots, green pepper and basil.  I've had a lot of Thai curries and this was one of the better ones - light on the coconut milk, nice variety of textures and flavor.  I ordered it medium hot which was right for me and I eat spicy food.  I suspect the hot would be very hot.

Only criticisms are that the orange chicken was simply chicken and rice, it would have been nice to see a bit of garnish with carrot.  And they didn't offer condiments, which I suspect we could have gotten if we'd asked, but the food didn't need it.
Hands down the best Thai in town!!! A must try! I've tried to order something different everytime I'm feeling Thai food and haven't found anything I didn't like!

I would give this place 0 stars if I could. I should have turned right around as soon as I saw how dirty and disgusting the fish tank was. Because I was with someone else I decided to give it a shot.  Mistake! I ordered the beef Pad Thai to be safe. As soon as I saw it I knew it was going to be bad news. It was very greasy with a very strong vinegar taste as well. I took one bite of the beef and wanted to vomit. I couldn't bear swallowing it. It tasted rotten. Instead of sending it back we paid for it and threw it away as soon as we walked outside. Don't waste your money. Definitely the worst Pad Thai ever!!!!

I would give it 4 and 1/2 stars as this place is our friends' favorite place for noodles.  It is small but clean.  We ordered chicken satay for appetizer, tasty and sliced beef flat noodles with bok choy, barbecue pork wonton rice noodle soup, seafood crispy noodle with wonton with gravy, and gold/silver noodle with chicken and shrimp.  All had big portions except for the gold/silver noodle which was smaller than before.  Prices are reasonable for what you get!

We love eating here as it is one of the best Thai restaurants in Vegas!  The food is very tasty and the prices are reasonable.  The place is small but has a relaxing atmosphere.  The service is very good.  Our food was brought out fairly quickly and it was nice and hot!  Give it a try because you won't be disappointed.

I finally had a visit to the infamous second TSNH.  Some folks say it doesn't live up to the original.  I am here to say that it does!  This is by far the best Thai restaurant on this side of town.  

We ordered the Khua-Kai, the combination Beef Noodle Soup (with glass noodle), and a dish not even offered on the menu.  Every single dish tasted just as good as the other Thai Style Noodle House, which is saying a lot.  Thai food is difficult to cook, and a lot of places have a disparity between the original chef and new chefs.  TSNH2 does not suffer from this hurdle as much as other Las Vegas Thai restaurants have shown in the past.

The Khua-Kai was spot on with the noodles and the sprouts and the homemade sweet and sour sauce.  We quite enjoyed it.  It was a nice balance to the spicier dishes that we ordered.

The combination Beef Noodle Soup is a must try at TSNH, as far as I am concerned.  The broth was just as rich and flavorful as the original location.  Most Thai places use a rather thin broth for this dish, but TSNH uses a thick and creamy beef based broth that cooks all day long.  Its just amazing.  I had this same soup at the original TSNH yesterday, and today at the new location it tasted exactly the same.  Loved it.

Overall, if you live in this part of town, this is the Thai restaurant to go to.  It is the most authentic out of the other spots located in this area, and it just tastes better.  Compared to the original, the interior is much nicer (newer building complex), but you will still see some familiar faces.  Awesome Thai food here!

I've been ordering from Thai Style Noodle House for a few years. Great prices and delicious.  I've tried several different Thai spots and always end up back here. For those customers that are reviewing and complaining yet frequent the business- maybe you shouldn't be so harsh and judgmental. You keep coming back for a reason so let's give them some credit.

We went to noodle house 2 on ft. apache and trop and it was the best thai we have had in vegas. We normally go to arayna or sweet basil as we look for dining options on the west side / summerlin area. Service was great. Host was great. Atmosphere was nicely decorated with good luck elephants. I asked to have us brought best dishes. We received the house special flat noodle with secret tangy sauce. I reccomend. And then the avocado pantang. Beat curry in vegas. Avocado was perfectly ripe and the shrimp went terrific with it. Make sure to order a thai coffee. Delicious with meal or just to lounge about.
Ok local thia for good prices. Nothing crazy but gets the job done. Come during lunch

I go to this restaurant about 2 times a month. I love everything here! I have tried almost 20 different items on their menu and every single one has been fantastic. 

Hands down, the best thing here is the potstickers! I wish they had an all you can eat potsticker special because quite frankly 6 isn't enough. :)

This place has very good food at a cheap price. I have never eaten at the restaurant as I always call in and order. 

I suggest this place to anyone in the mood for Thai food!
Okay I travel a lot and this place is one of the best I have been to. The price is outstanding and this place is worth the drive away from the strip. Go for it!

First things first. If you are looking for lunch specials or any type of specials...you're not gonna find any here. Same menu as lunch versus dinner.
 
Prices weren't too bad. $6.95 for a chicken pad thai plate. Couple bucks more if you want shrimp instead of chicken.

My boyfriend and I both got pad thai. Sorry...I'm original like that. I just can't go to a thai restaurant and NOT get pad thai. I would LOVE to try something different...but I could just never seem to do it.

I like spicy foods. Side note: not sure if everyone is aware of this, but on a scale of 1-10, 1 being the LEAST spicy and 10 being the MOST.
