----------------------------------------------­Service 4/5-----------------------------------------------­--
The service was standard for a fast food place. It wasn't extremely good but it wasn't bad either. The service was quite fast and when they messed up on my friends order, they automatically took it back and corrected it before serving the food.

--------------------------------------------­Cleanliness - 4/5---------------------------------------------
The location was clean front of house. Some of the furniture was worn down and old but it was still clean. 

Overall
Ok food for good price, fast and decent service. The location was good for a fast dinner   choice that cater to vegan clientele.

Fantastic lunch.  Excellent value.  Nice people.  The green curry pork truly hit the spot.  I've been to Thailand more frequently than to Reno, so I can wholeheartedly endorse this spot.  The dinner menu is quite standard with a few additional 'Chinese-style' dishes.  Beef Broccoli?  Sure.  Why not?  Next time is the acid test - Phad Thai and Tom Kar Gai.  If these pass muster, I'll be a frequent visitor.  Great find!  Thanks, Yelp.

So my wife and I are big fans of the Thai Style Noodle House in Chinatown.  We just recently saw that there is one in our neighborhood.  In fact, it's five minutes away, ON THE SAME STREET!!! We were very excited, and decided on night to have some delivered.  That was mistake number 1 for us.  They said that it would be 25-30 minutes.  After 45 minutes, I called them and they said that the driver was just now leaving.  15 minutes later, the driver calls me and says he cannot find our apartment complex.  I told him exactly how to get to our place from the restaurant, and he tells me it's not right.  So after a little back and forth, I finally convince him that I know what I'm talking about, and he's on his way.  15 minutes later, he cannot find our apartment building, blah blah blah.  To top it all off, they didn't even get our order correct.  Long story short, I wouldn't order delivery from them again, but I would go pick up takeout.
Bomb and cheap Thai food in Vegas, hands down! Their potstickers are very good, as well as the Panang curry chicken, and the garlic pepper chicken. Every time I go I want to feast!

Thai Style Noodle House was worthy of two visits within a week - lunch specials are a great deal here so we couldn't resist returning!

From 10:30 am to 4 pm, lunch specials are in full swing.  (This applies on weekends too!)  

For $5.95, you choose one item from their list and you also get soup of the day, steamed rice, and choice of appetizer (fried tofu, egg roll, or fried wonton).  For only two dollars more ($7.95), you can make it a two item lunch special from their list.  That's a pretty good deal already!

Soup of the day (on both visits) were an egg drop soup that had chunks of goodies in it and fried garlic on top.  A nice start to lunch.  

First visit, the Husband had the two item lunch special - Fried Garlic and Pepper Beef and the Panang Chicken with the Fried Tofu appetizer, whereas I had the one item lunch special - Yellow Curry with Tofu with the Fried Wonton appetizer.  With the two item lunch special, we thought they would give him less of each, but it was actually two full regular lunch portions.  Definitely a great deal!  They even asked if I wanted soft or fried tofu for my entree choice.  My curry was loaded with lots of veggies - carrots, string beans, bamboo shoots, napa cabbage, and baby corn.  All their entrees were good and tasty and we were both pleased with our choices.  

On our second visit, we both got the one item lunch - the Husband stayed with his Fried Garlic and Pepper Beef Choice with the Fried Wonton appetizer while I had the Panang with Tofu with Fried Eggroll appetizer.  They did get our spices mixed up on this visit though.  I requested medium while the Husband asked for spicy.  His has no spice while mine had all the heat.  It was still good nonetheless.

Be sure to ask for the Thai condiments - sometimes they automatically give it to you while other times you have to ask for it.

Their version of Thai iced tea is pretty good and a steal at $1.75.

Service is fine - both times we went was after the lunch rush so we were attended to as needed.

Overall, Thai Style Noodle House ranks up higher than some of the other Thai restaurants in the area offering lunch specials.

Minimum $15 for credit card use.
Yellow curry and coconut juice was amazing! We'll be back very soon. Our server was kinda mean but the food made up for it!
Very authentic! The best Thai spot in Vegas in my opinion. There food is so fresh and tasty. I love that it's down the street from where we live. And the service is great
The foods are so good , I ordered 2 chicken satay super yummy, and the price is so cheap, so 5 stars.i will be back

This place was sooooo amazing and inexpensive! My boyfriend actually recommended this place for their potstickers (which were a mouthgasm).

The service was okay. We went in on New Years Day and they forgot a few essential things like hot sauce, napkins, extra bowls, and even plates.... Haha but it's okay! The food totally made up for it.

We ordered the seafood soup with rice noodles, basil beef, chicken satay (on the tiny side) everything tasted fantastic and the price I paid was unbelievablely reasonable and way cheaper than any other thaifood place. Good prices and high quality food. I can't wait to come back :)

Food portions were way off, at least for the entrees that include rice. I ordered an entree for about $7.50 and it was 15% entree and 85% rice. They need to be a little more generous so I feel like I'm getting what I pay for. Will go elsewhere next time
The duck fried rice is always the bomb. Combination beef noodle was great!! No pics to post cause we devoured it already... Lol

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 27/100***

I come here for the affordable price point and good food. Though it isn't the best Thai food I've ever had, it's enough to satisfy any pesky cravings and in my humble opinion they have the best sticky rice and mango dessert. I'm a sucker for those things so I always order it no matter which Thai place I go to. It is not a complicated dessert and I've even made it myself a few times before but there's something about TSNH's version that makes it irresistibly good and so hard to stay away from. Another favorite is the Tom Kah Kai, it's a delicious soup with your choice of meat, it has mushrooms, lemon grass, tomato and has a coconut milk base. It's sooo good and depending on your heat tolerance they can customize the spiciness. It goes for most of their dishes like any other restaurant would. The pad thai is worth ordering as well. The kids really enjoyed their orange chicken and the hubby likes the fried rice with a side order of fried chicken. I have yet to try their curry but I'm confident I'll enjoy it like I do the rest of their offerings.

I love this place!! Pad se ew nom nom.
I love that I can say vegan and they say ok. Not huh. Hahaha thanks for feeding my belly

Wish I lived closer. Gotta say this place has my new favorite potstickers! A must have. 

Also ordered the Silver noodles with chicken and shrimps (yes the menu said shrimps...love the Asians ) asked for medium spicy and was perfect toy liking. 
A busy little place at lunch time midweek, yet was still served quickly. 

Great job guys!

I walked in 20 minutes before they closed and let me tell you....I had the BEST customer service ever!!! I wasn't rushed at all. The dish I ordered had avocado in it and they ran out. Never fear!!!! They added a double portion of chicken and shrimp!! Yayyyyyyy!!! Please chk this place out. You won't be disappointed. Promise !!!!

Always fast service and good food ! I love this place . I come here maybe 4 times a month and the ladies here always friendly. The lemonade is to die for. Try all there chicken rice dishes of my godddd delicious . I'm eating some orange chicken as I'm trying this !!!! I feel like Imma food coma. That's how good this place is every time I leave. The nose you'll spend for 2 is like 20 bux. Try it out, won't be dissappointed

The food is good but the service is always terrible. Beef and basil should not have oyster sauce in it and charging $2 for meat ball for my choice of meat is utterly ridiculous! I've been to all the locations and the service is the same. Usually Thai people are nice, courteous and eager to please but not here or the Jones location. The original one in Chinatown was the best.

It's really 4.5 stars

I visit the one in chinatown all the time and since  this one is closer to home it gets 5 stars, I will admit the one in chinatown is better though. Even though it should be the same stuff the flavors are not as good as the one in chinatown, but since it's so close to home I will give it that extra star. 

Tried the calamari for the first time the other day and it was really good, portions of the calamari was a little small but I would gladly get a smaller portion of a great dish than a large portion of a bad dish. 

Service is always great.

i decided i was hooked on their penang curry and wanted to eat it again.  however, i got curious about their penang curry with avocado and salmon since i've read great reviews on it.  For my boyfriend, he got what he always gets, bbq chicken over fried rice.

 I am saddened to say that i will be giving the cook only 2 stars.  Ever had old fish and just know its old because of the strong fishy taste?  well that's exactly how my salmon tasted.  i know what salmon tastes like and fresh salmon does not have a strong fishy odor or fishy taste.  I just did not get the same experience as everyone else who's had this.  

As for my boyfriend's experience, well lets just saw that he wasn't as impressed as he was the past two times.  The fried rice was not as tasty and clearly looked like it was cooked in no more than a minute.  Of course i'm over exaggerating but its just not as great as china town location and the first time we ordered from here.
Cheap prices.great food..noodle dishes are what you order here

I have been here 10+ times. My wife is from Thailand and we love coming here! Great service and food prices are very resonable. The employees work hard and are polite. Im getting hungry thinking about the place :) If you get a thai tea make sure they give the bigger cup I got the smaller cup a couple times and was dissapointed. I highly recommend giving this place a try!

We were out shopping and wanted something a little different and had a craving for some soup or noodles. We decided  on a combination. I had b
ever heard of this place but saw many 4 star reviews on YELP so we stopped in. As you arrive you are quickly greeted and seated. There were quite a few people in here and their bowls looked amazing. Looks like we made a great decision. Drink orders quickly taken (I LIKE THIS). We then looked over menu and decided on shrimp rolls as an appetizer. Very good choice on this nicely rolled flavorful and crunchy. Josie got the Chicken Noodle Soup minus the Tofu. I ordered the Roasted Duck Noodle Soup. They bring the spice on the side so you can heat it as you please. The duck soup had a salty earthy flavor I added to small spoon fulls of the Thai spice in the bowl they gave me. That added the bit of heat I needed and wanted. Josie enjoyed the Chicken Noodle said it filled her and warmed her on a brisk day in wintery Vegas. 

Everything here was on point. Service was excellent food was amazing. We will be back for the other Thai selections on this menu. If you are in area please try it you will not be disappointed.
Go to the one on jones instead, the food couldn't make up for the rude service from Keo and Meo at this location.
We first tried this through uber eats and loved it!..we like the orange chicken, pad see ew, and pad Thai!..we tried the curry also and it was good too but kinda small.

Yes ,this is #2 and sister to #1 on wynn, near chinatown.
I've found this place while driving by and decided on lunch and have been very happy find,as their lunch special are reasonable and a fair selection to chose from.. Sometimes they forget to give lunch menu, if they do ,just ask...I never had to wait to get in,as I have been there at several different times for lunch and brought friends the last time. Fyi I found if you order any noodle dish to go,they will end up clumpy,best to eat them in the restaurant.. I prefer the red curry, and found it very tasty and of course a glass of thai ice tea to cool off the spices,lol.. I did find I prefer this thai place,then the ones around the corner,which are a little more pricey...
Service has always been prompt and the only downfall is the napkin holder,which are not really napkin holder,but a small cup and I guess have to ask for any thai compliments for the table? I have yet to try #1,as last time there was a wait to get in and I was hungry and couldn't wait 30 mins...I prefer their 2 items lunch and will go back many times...yummy

As an obsessed, official Duchess of the original location, I felt obligated to try #2! We sampled lunch, and for some reason, I wanted to sample something different, so I didn't go for my usual curry. I ordered up some stir fried broccoli. Yes, American broccoli. I love it, and I wanted it. The dish was very simple and fresh. The green goods in a light sauce, which was similar to a brown sauce you might get at a Chinese restaurant. Of course, they have brown rice, but they do charge a bit extra now (.75). 

One thing that I did discover on this trip was the assortment of Thai condiments in little glass jars on the table. I had never used them before, but I decided, "Why the heck not?" Good decision on my part, as I am a big fan of the jalapenos and will probably add them on to all of my future dishes at Thai Style. A couple of those on some brown rice and I could be pretty happy. Yes, I am officially a cheap date.

Of course, the thing to note is the beautiful, new interior, which is very different from the hole-in-the-wall style of the original. Each has its own charm. 

Service was great. We even saw some familiar faces from #1. From what I can tell, they are going to be able to maintain quality at both locations. There were a couple of bumps while they were getting in new chefs for both locations, but based on my recent visits, both spots seem to be on the right track for tastiness!
Thai food is quick to cook...the technique takes longer to master!  Wouldn't recommend
Yummy veggie noodle soup... Veggie spring rolls and shrimp rolls are delicious... Lightly fried... Glad my family enjoyed it and they say that Vegas doesn't have good thai food..
Really good curry. Second time I have been here. First time I got a red curry and second green curry.
Great food low prices, what more could you ask for?! everything is excellent and authentic. We always get the duck fried rice and chicken pad se-eu.

I've been here a few times and other locations as well but this one tops them all. I love the customer service and the food seems to be a lot more tasty here. I made a to-go order of calamari, spicy eggplant with chicken, spicy basil with beef, and crab fried rice! Oooh, did I get your mouth all watery just yet??? Everything was cooked to the tee, flavored so well, and just on point! We've also tried the pad Thai and papaya salad which always hits home! If you're craving for Thai food, this is the place to be! Unbeatable prices for the portions you get and definitely worth every bite!

I decided to check it out because of the reviews and honestly probably one of the worst thai food I. 've ever had. I ordered the pumpkin yellow curry and it tasted like salt and no spices. Also, I could tell it's been sitting in the back for a while and was just continuously reheated due to that the potato's were mashed into the sauce. The reason I am giving two starts is because the service was really good and big portions.

Pros: Big portion, great service
Cons: Yellow curry

I gave it a 2 star  because of the ff:

1. Server - friendly 
2. Ambiance - okay
3. Wait - we waited for 30 minutes for our food 
4. Food - 2 star ( I ordered pork bbq with papaya salad) pork bbq is good, but papaya is really spicy for 7. My husband ordered combination soup which is alright. 
5. Price - okay

So my review could be a little skewed because I'm pregnant and starving BUT here's what happened: driving home from work, it suddenly dawns on me that I NEED something spicy. I Yelp places nearby and the word 'Thai' won me over. I call to order Drunken Noodles to go and pleasantly surprised it's ready just as I walk in! I could not have handed her my card any faster. Spork in the bag? Check. I speed walked to my car and OMG. It smells so good. I didn't wanna eat it all in the car but... I just couldn't stop. I mean, I'm eating for two so whatevs I own't judge me. Oh and on the way out, I was casually eyeing people's food and I saw some kind of soup that looked mouthwatering so you betta believe I'll be back. Moral of the story: So good I'm still sitting in my car to write about it.

Dined here for the first time maybe a moth ago and experience was great. Food was delicious and had a street food quality to it. Servers were nice and food came out fairly quick. We had no complaints.

2 nights ago, I called in for a pick up order and the gentleman who took our order was very rude. We were still deciding what we wanted to get and he was very impatient and had a negative tone while taking our order - we almost changed our minds and cancelled our order, but we were in a rush and already on our way to the restaurant. When I got there, I tried to pay with 2 credit cards and he wouldn't let me. When we dined inside, we paid with 2 cards no problem. Our receipt said his name was Victor. 

Our food was great, just the customer service from this one employee was terrible. Go for the food, just avoid Victor.

Great food and great staff , I have been coming here since it opened and each time the food and service has always  been great . There was a time I ordered to go and they said it would be finished in 15 minutes but couldn't get there till almost 35 minutes later but when I got there they told me they remade my food because it was getting cold , thats probably one of the first time a restaurant has ever done that for me haha . But anyways the staff is friendly and the food / portions are great . One thing I would suggest is getting new furniture or maybe new seats because the seats are starting to look a little gross but besides that great over all 5/5

They had great chicken pad thai and their pad sew (sp?) in black bean sauce was ok. My sister loves it, me I prefer the pad thai instead. I was told they're known for good food/poor service but to be honest i didnt experience any bad service. I also liked the fact that the prices were great and the food portion was enough to share/take home. Overall, I was pleased with my experience. Thank you.

My number one Thai restaurant in Vegas. I usually get vegetable noodle soup with the small rice noodle, pad see ew, pad Thai, spicy beef noodle soup.... top down with flavors that can not go wrong and the employees are always so helpful and friendly. They even remember who I am and honestly sometimes I think I'm there waaaayyy to often.... I should stop but can't help myself!!!

This place is horrible now with the new owners. The take out order are not what you order because the lady who took the order wrote it down wrong. I called to explain what was missing (a piece of fried chicken) and she told me to come all the way back and pay for it when I already did. I told her to just make the chicken and I swing by to pick it up but no she demands me to pay or nothing. I asked her for her name and to speak to the owners and she refused and hung up on me. Totally rude and horrible customer service. My family used to eat her every two weeks and notice that food tasted different lately and now we know why.

Been a while since we were in.  Cannot recall the last time, but things have changed.  The menu for one, it's not the same. Now I hear they have a new location.  

We made our usual selections, started with a yellow curry.  Chicken, the pieces were tender, the veggies, onion, potato, bell pepper, cut just the right size, and the curry, not to overwhelming with coconut milk, pretty good. 

I love eggplant and to please me, we ordered the spicy eggplant.  The eggplant is sauteed and is cooked well, there is a little hint of basil and thai chile, so not too spicy.  

And finally we got a noodle, I don't remember the name, it was a flat Noodle and came with chicken, egg, green onion and bean sprouts.  it was good.

Fast and friendly service.  

Although not on the menu we requested tofu with our meals and they were happy to add it. 

We ordered the vegaterian egg rolls Delish 
I ate soup and my husband beans,  friend tofu and rice.  Both were good. 

Price point was awesome
Our meals came to 20$ for two entrées and a appetizer 

We would go back again
They always deliver good food for a very fair price. The service is good too. Not the best thai food I've ever had but overall they're good.

The is food great!  All dishes have a good ratio of meat & vegetables.  If you're new to this restaurant, they do give great suggestions.  For the vegetarians out there, they have a vegetarian menu that they don't normally present unless you request it.  I absolutely love the vegetarian items.  Must haves are tofu larb and fresh ginger with steamed tofu.  Be sure to finish off with mango sticky rice.

Food is good and cheap. Service was bad. We order beef and they have us chicken. We told the waitress and she said oh but chicken is good right? Wtf! Service there is always bad but food are so good. Guess they don't care about customers service at all.

I usually go to the 'Thai Style Noodle House' on Jones because I love their thai fried rice.
So when I found out that there was a Thai Style Noodle House closer to my house, I had to go!

I came in with my mom and dad for dinner. I ordered (of course) the bbq pork fried rice with an egg on top, my mom ordered the pad thai, and my dad ordered the mongolian beef.

I've never actually dined in at Thai Noodle House since I usually take out and bring it to work, so this was my first time and let me just say the portion for the fried rice is huge! You can definitely share it among a couple people. 
I was super satisfied with the bbq pork portion as well! Their fried rice wasn't super greasy like other thai places' tend to be.

For dessert we ordered the sticky rice with mango and this was a real winner for me. I highly recommend it! It's warm sweet sticky rice with a heavy cream on top and mango on the side.
I won't be able to come here without getting it, I can tell you that.

Always eat here with Co-workers for lunch but will never go back. We called to place a order and we decided to have it delivered. The lady taking the order was going to charge the two of us ordering separate delivery charges and had attitude when asked why! Never again will we eat here again, so disappointed..

Delicious, cheap Thai food! I've been to the Chinatown location, but I think this location definitely is less crowded, looks newer/cleaner, and has better service.  It may be that I'm not observant but I don't remember the other location having duck as an option for the noodle dishes.  Pad see ew with duck is definitely better than the beef, chicken, etc options.  The tender slices of roast duck are nicely seasoned.  We also tried some appetizers, the crispy calamari is fried to perfection.  The fried chicken wings were disappointing, fried until they were slightly jerky in texture and no crispy crunch to the outside =(.  But overall, great place with great food....and helps that it's a few doors down from Sweet Addictions! Definitely head over there for an ice cream sandwich dessert!

This is my most favorite spot to eat Thai! The cost is so affordable and everything I've eaten I've been happy with. The staff could be friendlier but all in all its great! I've taken a lot of friends and family members here and they all love it as well. We are extremely sad though that they've stopped their lunch specials!!! Super sad about that.

Good little impromptu stop for Thai food! My friend got pumpkin curry and I got chicken pad Thai. Mine was delicious but on the spicy side for my English pallet. They gave me a free Thai iced tea to sooth my mouth which was not necessary but very thoughtful. My friend very much enjoyed her dish and that says a lot as a vegan curry connoisseur. We will be back! And I will ask for less hot haha!!

I was really pleased with our trip to this spot.  The restaurant was really cute, the service was exceptional, and the food was great.  
The Tom Kha was probably the best I've had in Vegas.  The flavor was spot on.  The Pad See Eu really stood out as well.  It ties for my favorite with The King and I (at The Lakes).  
I'm removing one star because the dish my boyfriend ordered (a flat noodle dish, with chicken, and Thai style gravy) was really gross.  I don't know if it just wasn't our thing...but this was something else.  The gravy was...abundant, and slimy.  I tried to give this a shot after refrigeration, when the gravy "settled", but it still looked very visually off-putting, and really didn't taste that great.  
Other than the one disappointing dish, our visit went great.  I'm sure we'll be back.

My review is probably closer to a 3.5 than a 4, but since Yelp does not permit 1/2 stars, I did not want to unfairly punish the place by only giving it 3 stars. For a quick and delicious lunch or dinner, this place does it right.  The curry with duck is my fav.

I love Thai food. But every time I come here I always order one thing: the combination beef noodle soup! Its sooo good. And on rainy days, its even better. If you're thinking its like beef pho, it is not. Its much more hearty and savory. I don't know anyone else tried it and disliked it. Its also called a "boat noodle". Yum.

The hubby always orders his favorite dish too. The chicken and shrimp silver noodle. Its so refreshing. Light but full of flavor too. I highly recommend this dish as well. 

Their prices are also extremely decent for their quality. No need to go to an expensive Thai restaurant when you can get it all here.

I'll keep coming back!

I love this place . There food is very good . They have a number customer service . It's always good I usually try to go to this place once a week . They also have really good Thai tea and there orange chicken is so light  that you taste the chicken instead of the bread

Great food with great time management. I come here kind of often but this time, the service was S H I T. The neglected and I find it very unprofessional when the employees are eating right in front of us.

It's a bit small but most of the time the place is vacant

I ordered the bbq Chicken over fried rice and it is one of my fav dish on the menu. It's delicious with the sauce!! ($6.95)
Rating- 8.9

Also I got the Panang curry spicy 5. I wish there was more green peppers and meat rather than sauce. It's enough to fill one to two people. ($6.95)
Rating- 7.7

Definitely give this plAce a try if you're into thai food :)
This is our go-to for quick, yet delicious Thai take out! They have an extensive menu and the staff is always very nice.
Great Pad see eu for the price! Also accommodated my request for no msg, sugar and fish sauce. Nice people

Place is decently price and delicious. Came here for dinner and enjoyed my experience. Place was empty, but it was 9pm which is pretty late for dinner. I ordered the chicken skewers, tum yum soup, pad thai, and duck fried rice. The chicken skewers (#10 on the menu) were good, above average. I enjoyed eating it with the peanut sauce. The tum yum soup was also above average. I would of liked it with some rice, I liked it but wasn't blown away. I'm a big fan of pad thai but was unimpressed with the dish here. It wasn't bad but I had better at random Thai restaurants. The duck fried rice was delicious and my favorite dish of the night. Definitely a must try. Overall, I had a good dinner and was happy to try this place. I definitely recommend trying it once.

Awesome food. My toddlers loved the fried chicken (thin strips) and fried rice. I had the spicy Thai noodle with 5 out of 10 spicy and really enjoyed it. We also ordered WooChee salmon and the 3 spice sauce was crazy yummy. 
It is a small casual, mompop kind of place. Service was friendly.  We will be coming back regularly.

So my friend took me here because they have really good fried rice dishes and soups. The duck fried rice was super yummy. The first star was lost because our first dish with sticky rice was way too small for the price.. you would probably have to order 10 of those to get full. It's the dish photographed. It tasted great, just very small for the price. The other minus was for the service, I don't think the server we had spoke a word of English. She just came and dropped off stuff. For example when she came with extra plates for me and my friend she just dumped them on the table paired instead of placing them on mine and his side. Will go back to try their Tom Ka soup but not because of the service.
The broth and meat was delicious. The only problem I had was a surplus of bean sprouts and not enough noodles. Everything else was amazing!

Solid Thai restaurant. I had the avocado curry with shrimp. Their medium is actually close to what I'd say is a medium, unlike many places that go light on spice. The dish is a good deal for the price too, not overly large but sufficiently filling, and the flavor is solid. I was also satisfied with the service. I'd go back again.

I'm so glad we came here! Food was awesome!!! We ordered the Thai fried rice,  wonton soup and the pad Thai ; all dishes were great. Clean flavors, fresh and perfectly seasoned! Service was good too. The young girl who helped us was very nice, same with the young guy. The older lady, maybe the manager or owner, not as friendly but I think maybe she is just too focused in the business. Prices are ridiculously low, less than $7 for most dishes. Highly recommend it !

Fish Cake appetizer with a sweet sauce - fabulous!  

Roasted Duck Noodle Soup - so delicious!  Broth is dark with loads of flavour.  Garnish of garlic chips for garlic lovers!  Instead of a bowl, it was served in a deep casserole dish.  Different.

Rad Na - Fried Rice Noodles with Chinese Brocolli and Beef in a brown gravy sauce - it was okay for me.  The sauce was on the thick side.   

The restaurant is very casual.  The owner was very friendly.

So my friend and I have had lunch here 3 times.... Food is actually very good and prices affordable, but the SERVICE is HORRIBLE!! Your afraid to even ask for utensils. The last server we had was a male and he had a personality of a chopstick. When you asked for anything he looked at us like we were ridiculous for asking for napkins (hence nothing was on the tables... no utensils, napkins, condiments).  I know it's just lunch but it is a sit down place n you are paying gratuity, make some effort to make your customers feel comfortable while eating at your establishment;(

There's a ton of Thai restaurants to choose from, but this place is not too shabby. Service is great, and the food has been good so far. 

Appetizer combo platter- 4 star. You can get a taste of the crab rangoon, fried tofu (wasn't a fan), egg rolls (kinda like the plain veggie style at panda), fried shrimp (delicious), chicken satay (amazing). I think it's a nice platter to get a taste and all for $8.95 or so. 

Noodle soup with chicken and bean sprouts in chicken broth - 5 star. I got it with flat noodles. Spice level 7. Delicious!

Crispy pork and chinese broccoli- 3 star. The pork tasted a bit off, and it could have been crispier. I've had better, but wasn't too bad. 

Spicy seafood fried rice- 4 star. 

Pad See Ew- 4 star.

Glass noodle salad- 4.5 star.  It's clear noodles tossed in lime. Delicious!

Missing my Thai noodle joint in LA. If you're ever around the area- hit up Pa Ord Noodle in E. Hollywood... The BEST soups.... So good, after I ate the meat and noodles; I wanted to drink the bowl of soup! That broth is good.....

With that high expectation.... Thai Style Noodle House didn't meet it. Don't get me wrong TSNH is good! But it's not Pa Ord.

TSNH's portion is very generous (love it!),  the decor is clean, service is friendly and they also deliver within a 3 mile radius.

Overall 3.5 stars, good food, good service, and good prices- I'll go for another round.

Papaya salad...delicious!  Love the soups and my husband says the mongolian beef is the best he has ever had.  The fried rice is amazing!  The pad thai is not so great but I can live without as long as I have other great items which I do!  The Thai iced tea is delicious!  This place is so affordable it's awesome!
BEST noodles I've ever had! This is my new go-to place for my noodle cravings! And super friendly staff!

Recently I ordered take out here and I was greeted immediately when I walked in. The wait time for my food was less then 15 minutes and I was out that door. I ordered the Pad See Eww- it was delicious, Fried Pork with Chinese broccoli- never disappoints me, squid salad and somtum was not what I expected. I always ask for the squid salad to be less sweet and more on the sour side but they can't seem to make it sour enough. 

As for the Somtum I requested it to be made Lao style with 1 Thai pepper which would be enough spice for me and asked for it to be extra sour. Well it wasn't sour, and I think they skipped on the pepper or didn't use real Thai chili pepper/prik ki nou. It really makes a difference on the type of chili you use. 

Overall, the food is still great and the prices are the best in town!!

I agree with one reviewer here, there has been a bunch of Thai restaurants popping up all over Ft. Apache lately and I've tried most of them and so far my favorite is still Archie's, UNTIL I found this place!

I called and ordered take out and the food is ready in 15 minutes.
Everything was delicious and just the right amount of spice.
I usually order a 2 spice level and most of the time it will be way too hot but not this place, they got it just right.

I ordered:
SIlver Noodle Salad, Thai Fried Rice with Chicken, Thai Spice Noodle with Beef, and Yellow Curry and my total was $29! It's the cheapest Thai restaurant around here and the food is delicious and very generous portions, what more can you ask for?

Really like this place! The soups and noodles are great. I specially like tom kha and beef noodle soup. Fried rice is wicked too. Pineapple rice is delicious.

I have a weird habit of having dinner here after a long day in the office. Soups are healthy, big, and cheap. Best meal under $10!
The food was absolutely delicious. And very very reasonably priced. Everything I ate was just spectacular. I was feeling a bit ill so I ordered a soup. I wasn't disappointed.

Pork jerky...check...
Reasonable price...check...
Overall a decent meal for a decent price...I've had better..but will definitely come back for the pork jerky...service is good too, so definitely worth trying.

I really liked the Thai Red Curry (Seafood) I ordered from this place. The price was good, too, something like $8.50. It was just perfect.

Howeverrrr.....

It was just me & hubby at the resto when we walked in. Our server had a lot of time to do things between taking our order & serving our food.

He chose to spend his spare time cleaning the fish tank. Using his hands. I should have taken a photo of the fish tank, its water brown & murky. I'm pretty sure that water had fish cr** in it, plus other contaminants & I dunno, possibly diseases. I didn't see our server wash his hands after cleaning the tank. He just wiped them with napkins. Sorry, I just thought that was really unsanitary :/

Haven't gone here in a long time and I have to say things haven't changed. 

I decided to see if it had gotten any better, I am referring to the service. it doesn't matter who you get they are all equally terrible and rude. This will be my very last visit here since nothing will ever change. 

I ordered a Thai Chai tea with milk (cold version). The lady delivers my drink and I tasted it and it was pure sugar you couldn't taste anything else but sugar! On prior occasions this was not the case! I asked her to take it back and add more milk less Thai tea. So she brings it back but no change at all even after adding more milk. So after taking one sip I told her I could not drink it and she actually had the $&@;! to tell me not to order it again that it would always be like that. She was lecturing me like a child and for the sake of not making a usual scene like I would if I was alone. This time I was quiet and didn't talk back.

Was so hungry after work, thank goodness they were still open.  I ordered the beef pad see ew, and the pork fried rice. Loved them both.  Lots of beef tender noodles and just the right spices.
